properties.Title: Civil Emergency, Update From Sk Provincial Emergency Communications Centre
properties.Summary:
Description: This emergency advisory alert is being issued for the province of Saskatchewan. All travelers returning from outside of Canada are subject to a mandatory 14 day self isolation order. Violation of the order may result in a fine of 2000 dollars.
Expires: 2021-03-03T17:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2021-02-17T10:59:47-06:00, E13CAF2D-F525-5B74-06E5-B324A694A217
Area: Province of Saskatchewan
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm is expected. Locations: Corner Brook and Gros Morne. Time span: continuing into this afternoon. Remarks: Snow and wind will combine to reduce visibility at times in blowing snow, especially over exposed areas. Conditions will improve this afternoon as snow tapers off to flurries. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-17T22:59:18-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T14:24:18-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2208572281.2021
Area: Corner Brook and vicinity, Gros Morne
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall continues today. Additional snowfall amounts: 5 cm. Locations: western, central, and northeastern Newfoundland. Time span: continuing into this afternoon. Remarks: Snow will taper to flurries this evening. Snow may mix with ice pellets over some areas this morning. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snowfall warnings are issued when significant snowfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-17T21:59:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T08:41:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1764705234.2021

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow squalls developing Thursday morning. Snow squalls are forecast to develop over the west end of Lake Ontario Thursday morning and continue through Thursday night. These snow squalls have the potential to produce 15 cm in 12 hours. Current indications suggest that the snow squalls could affect shoreline areas from Toronto Island to Burlington as well as areas inland. Motorists should be prepared for possible winter driving conditions, especially along the QEW and portions of highway 403 and 407 on Thursday. ### Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-18T12:10:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T20:11:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0303683283.2021
Area: City of Toronto, Mississauga - Brampton, Halton Hills - Milton, Burlington - Oakville
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Maximum winds: northeasterly 40 gusting to 60 km/h. Location: the Great Northern Peninsula. Time span: this afternoon. Remarks: Visibility is expected to be poor over some areas due to a combination of snow and blowing snow. Conditions will improve by late afternoon as snow tapers to flurries and winds begin to ease. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-17T21:59:34-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T19:12:34-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2501568514.2021
Area: Northern Peninsula East, Parson's Pond - Hawke's Bay, Port Saunders and the Straits
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of very cold wind chills is expected. Wind chills near -55 will return tonight at Sanirajak and Igloolik. Slight moderation is expected Thursday morning as the coldest air moves out of the region towards northern Baffin Island. ### Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-18T12:27:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T20:28:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3595435661.2021
Area: Sanirajak, Igloolik
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory this morning. Lake effect snow bands and heavy flurries will move into the region and shift back and forth across the region through this morning giving variable amounts of snow. Local amounts of 5 to 10 centimetres are possible. Travel may become hazardous at times this morning due to accumulating snow and slippery conditions. Visibility could locally be reduced at times in heavy flurries. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-17T23:29:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T10:24:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0580833735.2021
Area: Agawa - Lake Superior Park, Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay, Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Extreme Cold Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Extreme cold wind chill values between minus 55 and minus 60 may persist until Friday. ### Watch for cold related symptoms: shortness of breath, chest pain, muscle pain and weakness, numbness and colour change in fingers and toes. Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Snowfall: 5 to 10 cm. Maximum winds: east to northeast 40 gusting to 60 km/h. Location: Green Bay - White Bay. Time span: this afternoon. Remarks: Visibility is expected to be poor, especially over exposed coastal communities, as snow combines with wind to produce blowing snow. Conditions are expected to improve late this afternoon as snow tapers off to flurries and winds begin to ease. ### Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-18T01:59:13-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T14:18:13-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3378373236.2021
Area: Green Bay - White Bay
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong frontal system will track across Haida Gwaii early Thursday morning. Ahead of the front, southeast winds 90 to 110 km/h will develop over Haida Gwaii near midnight tonight and ease Thursday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-18T04:39:37-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T12:40:37-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2780005220.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. A strong frontal system will track across Haida Gwaii late tonight into early Thursday morning. The front will make its way into the north coast and northern Vancouver Island early Thursday morning then depart to the east by Thursday afternoon. The front will generate southeast winds at 90 to 110 km/h as it moves through these regions. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. High winds may toss loose objects or cause tree branches to break. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2021-02-18T11:21:30-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T19:22:30-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3298059741.2021
Area: Haida Gwaii, North Vancouver Island, Central Coast - coastal sections
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total Snowfall: 5 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 70 km/h. Locations: Norman Bay to L'Anse-au-Clair. Time span: this afternoon. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strong winds to produce poor visibility in blowing snow. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility in some locations. Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2021-02-17T22:41:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2021-02-17T14:49:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3644710932.2021
